content.description: Start on nice ledge above head.  Climb straight up and make the cruxy and spooky mantle to top out.
content.protection: a pad and probably a spotter.
content.location: Near all the garbage graffiti in the middle of the main overlook.

content.description: Start matched on the undercling jug with low small feet. Follow a discontinuous seam of oddly shaped crimps up and slightly right from the start. Feet are hard to come by for the first few moves up this steep slab.
content.location: On the main overlook, the uphill side of the block housing Claw Mark and Tiny Claw Mark.

content.description: Sit Start and climb up the small crack left of the large one.

content.location: Where all the lame graffiti is on the main overlook.

content.description: Start with two hands on thumbwrap sidepull, pull hard to sloper and go left to juggy corner of crack, easy topout from corner of crack. (Potential sit start from small flake to the right)
content.location: Located on the porkchop boulder to the left of the "bears cub" line

content.description: Sit Start and climb the large crack.
content.location: Far left side of the main overlook.

content.description: Start matched on a thick flake (beware: feels a bit loose), shift right to undercling on the start hold, throw left hand high on the left arete to a good pinch. Use one or two sharp edges in the middle of the face to bump your right hand up towards an easy top out.
content.location: Uphill face of the boulder that is home to BFB

content.description: Scramble up and climb the lip to a somewhat spooky mantle.
content.protection: a pad and a spotter if this is your climbing grade
content.location: far left of the main overlook.

content.description: Start matched on the small jug on the back side of the boulder, good left side pull and a right bump to a sharp crimp, drop left hand down to the small crystal jib, shift your feet and bump the left hand to the vertical pocket. Easy safe top out
content.location: Bigger boulder about 100m under the main overlook, looks like a pork chop looking down on it. Start hold is on the down hill side. Fist sized jug about waist high.

content.description: Start low on the arete on opposing side pulls and small feet. Make one tough move out of the start to a sharp pinch on the arete, then follow easy (if somewhat smaller than desired) horizontal protrusions to the top.
content.location: uphill arete of the same boulder that is home to BFB

content.description: Sit start and make way up a thin vertical crack to a small crimp and finish up through the middle of the face.
content.location: Look for the rock towards the top of the boulder landslide.

content.description: Start to the right of the baseball player stenciled on the rock. Matching start at the ledge, follow crimps diagonally up toward the top left of the rock. Then follow crimps up the middle and top out at the “top of the arrow”
content.location: Start at the bottom right corner of this triangle

content.description: This would be classic if it wasn't for the horrible landing risk if you miss the ledge and fall an extra 10ft on top of however far up the route you get.  Don't climb unless you're confident at this grade.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter!!  Make that three spotters.
content.location: Look for the ugliest looking route due to the hideous graffiti.  (Graffiti is for trains not rocks.)  Located in the middle of the main overlook.

content.description: Lots of hikers, easy approach, mostly "lowball" problems
